column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=DS : After Hurricane Katrina there was a lot of debate on whether we would rebuild one of our own cities as we were over in Iraq demolishing their cities .
#Text=How did you feel about that ?
#Text=GT :
#Text=I was there a month after it hit .
#Text=I had a friend down there , Julia Kass , who I went to see .
#Text=I stayed in a hotel -- there were hotels functioning .
#Text=It was n't that everything was destroyed ; there were parts that were n't --
#Text=DS : Yeah , the high areas ; the rich areas --
#Text=GT : -- that 's right .
#Text=And this was a rich area .
#Text=It was a good hotel .
#Text=She would get in her car , Miss Julia Kass , and take me around .
#Text=And boy did I see that town ... it ... it ... it was just like what you read .
#Text=And it 's like the military : the outside people just did n't care .

#Text=The poor blacks , as there are always those who are invaded by the forces of nature and are not protected then or later , they are the people who get sucked up into this swamp of military life or a disaster such as Katrina .
#Text=And the sense of humanity and human rights are n't there .
#Text=We have a human rights lobby in this country .
#Text=Amnesty International is very quick to point fingers at countries who are failing , at Darfur or the Chinese with regard to the Tibetans .
#Text=But right in our own country --
#Text=New Orleans -- the outrage was never equal to what should have been proper and humanely expedient .
#Text=It 's still a class thing .
#Text=The country is really divided by class .
#Text=DS : More than it used to be ?

#Text=GT : Well , considering that what this country 's history should be , which is a learning experiment , which is going back to the time of legally abolishing racism in schools and jobs , what came out of the civil rights struggle ; all those wonderful laws like Brown v. Board of Education and all .
#Text=But we are still a racial society .
#Text=And it 's no less true with the schools in New York than the schools in Alabama .
#Text=I 've been to Selma , Alabama every year for the last thirty or forty years .
#Text=I wrote about it when I was one of the reporters in 1965 , and I have not failed to go to that town since then once every year .
#Text=DS :
#Text=Every year you go to Selma ? Why ?
#Text=GT : To watch it .
#Text=I think it 's a little town that gives a good face of America .
#Text=DS : There was a Times report , I think , about Selma and they say that it is very changed .
#Text=GT : Bullshit !
#Text=There 's always a report .
#Text=Absolute bullshit !
#Text=They go down there every March 7 , John Lewis comes out of Atlanta and they go march , and there 's some old crotchety group of what 's left over from the Bloody Sunday massacre .
